intro: Trifolium hirtum subsp. diffusum, commonly known as hairy clover, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, featuring trifoliate leaves with hairy surfaces and small white or pink flowers. The plant thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides. It is known for its ability to fix nitrogen, making it beneficial for soil fertility. Its delicate appearance and ecological value make it a notable species in botanical studies.
